basics.name: Matias Barandiaran Rivera
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: A highly motivated second-year Computer Science student at Lancaster University, with a keen interest in quantum software, machine learning, and formal verification. Demonstrated practical experience in these areas through a research sector placement and remote certifications. Enthusiastic to further leverage this experience by pursuing research assistant roles to actively contribute to these innovative domains.

work.name: Department of Computer Science, Lancaster University Leipzig
work.summary: Laboratory assistant and demonstrator for the Digital Systems 1st year module.
highlights: Delivering engaging and informative instructional sessions to facilitate student understanding.

work.name: Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Charles University
work.summary: Worked on proof production for Golem CHC solver.
highlights: Achieved successful production of Alethe verifiable proof for the LIA-lin and LIA-nonlin benchmarks.

work.name: Freelance, IB Diploma
work.summary: Student advisor and tutor for Mathematics: Analysis and Approaches SL and HL.
highlights: Guided senior high school IB Diploma students to achieve outstanding exam performance and substantial growth in their mathematical abilities.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the Qiskit Fall Fest 2023 event for LU Leipzig community.
highlights: Organized and ran an event with the aim of giving students a holistic and multi-faceted view of the exciting field of quantum computing.
Assembled a series of seminars that combined academic depth and real-world practical insights (Special guests: Enrique Solano - Kipu Quantum.)
Gave an introductory talk on quantum computing and held workshops with Qiskit material.

volunteer.summary: Founder of Lancaster University Leipzig's Robotics Club.
highlights: Dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation and problem-solving within my institution.
Club serves as a dynamic platform for students to explore the fascinating world of robotics, igniting their passion for technology and hands-on learning.
Club fund gathering evidenced my organization and leadership skills.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
